issues.description: The Problem Statement (Part 2) instructs students to implement messageOnMilk(double milkVolume) that returns a string including the milkVolume (e.g. "[Animal Type] [name] is milked (volume: [milkVolume]L)"). However the UML, the template usage (Main.java) and the reference solution define/message call messageOnMilk() with no parameters and return a string without any volume information. This is a cross-artifact method parameter mismatch that will confuse students about the correct method signature to implement and will prevent compiling or passing tests if they follow the textual instruction in Part 2.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the specification consistent with the UML/template/solution. Either: (A) Update the Problem Statement Part 2 to require messageOnMilk() with no parameters and adjust the example return to "[Animal Type] [name] is milked" (i.e., remove the milkVolume parameter and volume text), or (B) if the intent is to include volume, update the UML, the template usages (calls in Main), and the solution to use messageOnMilk(double milkVolume) everywhere and change implementations to include the volume in the returned string. Option A is the smaller change and aligns with the current template and solution.

issues.description: The problem text requires a method messageOnMilk(double milkVolume) (including a double parameter and a return string containing the volume), but both the template usage and the solution implementation use a parameterless messageOnMilk() that returns a string without a volume. This mismatch between the textual specification and the actual interface/implementations creates ambiguity about the required method signature and return format. Students may implement the method with the double parameter (as described in the text) and then fail to match the template/tests (which expect messageOnMilk() with no parameter), or be unsure which form to follow.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the textual specification with the code. Either (A) update the problem statement to require a parameterless messageOnMilk() that returns "[Animal Type] [name] is milked" (matching the UML, template usage, and current solution), or (B) change the interface and all implementations to messageOnMilk(double milkVolume) and update template usage and tests accordingly (and provide guidance/example showing the expected formatted return: "[Animal Type] [name] is milked (volume: [milkVolume]L)"). Option (A) is the minimal fix to preserve the current template/solution and avoid breaking tests.
